revised_title: An Analysis of Mortality and Health in Chester in 1773
tldr: This article presents a detailed analysis of mortality and health in Chester in 1773, focusing on the bill of mortality, which includes data on deaths, ages, and diseases. The author highlights the city's remarkable healthiness, with a higher proportion of inhabitants living to older ages compared to other towns. The article also discusses the utility of such data for medical and political purposes, as well as the importance of accurate record-keeping for calculating life expectancies and annuities.
